data.question: Which of the following best describes an enabler?

option: A. Individual and contextual levers that make it harder to speak up and act on your values.

B. An action that creates ethical dilemmas through lack of practice
and reflection.

C. Individual and contextual levers that help us speak up and
act on our values.
D. An action that resolves ethical dilemmas through practice and reflection.

response.content: That is incorrect. Enablers are the just the opposite - levers that make it easier (not harder) to speak up and act on your values.
That is incorrect. Enablers are not actions that create ethical dilemmas. Instead, they are levers that make it easier to speak up and act on your values.
That is correct. Enablers are levers that make it easier to speak up and act on your values.
response.showAnswer: The correct answer is C. Enablers are levers that make it easier to speak up and act on your values.

response.content: That is incorrect. Enablers are not actions that resolve ethical dilemmas. Instead, they are levers that make it easier to speak up and act on your values.
